alert.note: Alert for San Diego (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 22 at 10:59AM PST until January 22 at 1:00PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Diego has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Northern Coast Western Valley Locations in San Diego County... * Until 100 PM PST. * At 1059 AM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain falling across the warned area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen in the past 4 hours. The expected rainfall rates for additional rain is 0.3 to 0.5 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area this afternoon. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. Department of Highways is reporting road closures. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways including SR-78, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Oceanside, Carlsbad, Vista, Encinitas, Del Mar, Fallbrook, Camp Pendleton, Escondido, San Marcos and Solana Beach. Impacting portions of SR-78. This includes the following streams and drainages... Buena Vista Creek, Lusardi Creek, Windmill Canyon, Chicarita Creek, Las Pulgas Canyon, McGonigle Canyon, Newton Canyon, Poway Creek, Aliso Canyon, San Dieguito River, Jardine Canyon, Horno Canyon, French Canyon, San Marcos Creek, Sandia Canyon, Buena Creek, Agua Hedionda Creek, Piedra de Lumbre Canyon, Roblar Creek, South Fork Moosa Canyon, Gopher Canyon, Escondido Creek, Pilgrim Creek, San Onofre Creek, Pacific Ocean, San Luis Rey River, Moosa Canyon, Encinas, Canyon de las, Rainbow Creek, San Mateo Creek, South Fork Gopher Canyon, Santa Margarita River, De Luz Creek, Encinitas Creek, North Fork San Onofre Canyon and Loma Alta Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.3-0.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
